Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Use tsLSHost.fileExists() to resolve modules
Issues.Body:
The ModuleResolutionHost implementation inside ReflectorHost currently
relies on reading the snapshot to determine if a file exists, and use
the snapshot to retrieve the file content.
It is more straightforward and efficient to use the already existing
method fileExists() instead.

At runtime, the TypeScript LanguageServiceHost is really a Project, so
both fileExists() and readFile() methods are defined.

As a micro-optimization, skip fs lookup for tsx files.

Issues.Title: bazel: ng_package rule generates invalid secondary entry-point definitions
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

@angular/bazel

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Currently for secondary entry-points, the `ng_package` rule creates a new folder
in the output. e.g.

```
| @angular/cdk/ 
| -- tree/
| -- -- package.json
| -- -- tree_public_index.d.ts
| -- -- tree_public_index.metadata.json
```

The `package.json` for `cdk/tree` has a field for `typings` which resolves to the `./tree_public_index.d.ts` file. This sounds reasonable at first glance.

Though it becomes problematic if we have top-level re-exports (as specified in the Angular package format). e.g.

```
| @angular/cdk/ 
| -- tree/
| -- -- package.json
| -- -- tree_public_index.d.ts
| -- -- tree_public_index.metadata.json
|
| tree.d.ts // re-exports from ./tree/tree_public_index.d.ts
| tree.metadata.json // re-exports from ./tree/tree_public_index.metadata.json
```

Now if someone externally imports a component from `@angular/cdk/tree`, it will match the `tree.d.ts` file in the package root. Meaning that `ngfactory` files etc. are generated **next** to that file.

But if something references a component of `cdk/tree` through the `cdk/tree/tree_public_index.d.ts` file (which can happen for imports within the entry-point itself; or if NGC creates a factory that imports a symbol from there).


In those cases. NGC assumes that the `ngfactory` is generated within the secondary-entry point folder (`cdk/tree/tree_public_index.ngfactory.js`), but the factory already got generated at a different location (next to `tree.d.ts`). Ultimately it ends with a path resolution failure.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Didn't spend time creating a minimal reproduction, but can try if that is desired. Note that most of the APF packaging tools out there do either not generate top-level re-exports, or just reference the top-level typings file in the entry-point definition. For example:

https://github.com/angular/material2-builds/blob/master/expansion/package.json#L3

**Anything else relevant?**

Unless I miss something, we should be able to just remove the metadata and typing re-exports for secondary entry-points. They don't seem to provide any value.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bazel: ng_package rule generates invalid secondary entry-point definitions" (#32651)

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): support specifying flat module entry-point
Issues.Body:
Currently when building packages with the `ng_module` bazel
rule, it's not possible to select which source file should
be used as entry-point for the flat module bundle. This is
different to non-Bazel where developers have full control
over the entry-point as they can just specify a single file
in the `tsconfig#files` option which will then be picked up.

With Bazel, all specified source files (within the `srcs`
attribute) are explicitly included in the generated tsconfig
files.. making it impossible to select a specific file as
entry-point. Previously a workaround solution was tried to
solve this. The logic tried to determine the entry-point by
looking for files called `index.ts`. This is not sufficient
as most of the time the flat module bundle *should* be
called "index". This causes a conflict as the entry-point
as well as the bundle output have the same file path/name.

In the components repository, we want to generate the
flat module bundle with the name "index", and the
entry-point should be the "public-api.ts" file. This is
what we currently _can_ control with plain NGC.. but not
with Bazel.. hence the proposed change here.

**Note**: This is a proposal. Happy to discuss better alternatives!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(bazel): support specifying flat module entry-point" (#32650)

Issues.Title: @angular/service-worker caching 3rd party api calls and causing cross-origin read blocking warnings
Issues.Body:
### üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/service-worker@8.2.5 ### Is this a regression? No, I believe the ngsw calls to 3rd party APIs have been happening all along but the Chrome cross-origin read blocking (CORB) warnings are new. ### Description My angular app is a PWA and when it makes any calls to 3rd party APIs, ngsw-worker.js will fetch the same API call again. My 3rd party APIs include gtm (google tag manager), google maps, mongodb stitch. The Stitch call made by ngsw-worker.js is the one now throwing the CORB errors once upgrading from angular 7 to 8. Mongodb Stitch API package was not updated. The original stitch call is a post, the calls made by ngsw-worker.js are an OPTIONS and a POST. Chrome dev tools says the OPTIONS call is the one throwing the CORB warning. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Not able to create a PWA StackBlitz repo. But add any 3rd party API call to a minimal PWA and it will repo. I was able to repo the ngsw-worker.js loading the 3rd party calls, by doing the following ng new testapp cd testapp ng add @angular/pwa Add a script tag to a 3rd party script, such as the following Google Maps API line to the bottom of index.html just before the end tag:
npm install http-server ng build --prod http-server -p 8080 -c-1 dist/testapp open http://localhost:8080/ check network calls and see that ngsw-worker.js makes a call to re-load the google maps api call. ## üî• Exception or Error The error is that ngsw-worker.js is re-loading 3rd party api calls. The following exception is coming from ngsw-worker.js re-calling my mongodb stitch api call in my full app (not the minimal repo). I will include a link to my website when I release the updated version after testing has finished.

Issues.Title: Module Resolution Cache never gets invalidated
Issues.Body:
Module resolution done by the ReflectorHost is cached to improve performance, but the cache never gets invalidated. This might cause the Angular language service to be in an inconsistent state. This bug is used to keep track of the potential problem, and to discuss possible mitigation.

PR that caused this: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/32479
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Module Resolution Cache never gets invalidated" (#32643)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): avoid repeat lview reads in pipe instructions
Issues.Body: All of the `pipeBind` instructions call into `isPure` and `unwrapValue` which in turn call `getLView` internally. These internal calls are redundant, because we already have the `LView` from the `load` calls just before it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(ivy): avoid repeat lview reads in pipe instructions" (#32633)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Lazily instantiate MetadataResolver
Issues.Body:
The instantiation of the resolver also requires instantiation of the
StaticReflector, and the latter requires resolution of core Angular symbols.
Module resolution should not be done during instantiation to avoid potential
cyclic dependency between the plugin and the containing Project, so the
Singleton pattern is used to create the resolver.

Issues.Title: Make more descriptive errors for directives' errors in AOT build
Issues.Body:
angular/angular-cli#11187 üöÄ Feature request



### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test

- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update

- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
AOT show errors of internal directives like HostListener, HostBinding in not so descriptive way like
 `(1,1): : Directive IntroComponent, Expected 0 arguments, but got 1`
BTW (1,1) line in the message is also invalid, as I understand it check values inside directives after optimizations. The reason for this issue was a lot of questions on StackOverflow with no solution due to not so clear error message.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
I suggest doing more descriptive error messages for errors like 
`(25,34): : Directive HostListener inside IntroComponent, Expected 0 arguments, but got 1`
and check them before angular optimizations

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
I followed the Angular Getting Started tutorial on StackBlitz, and it went well until I got to the Deployment section and had to download my code locally to build it for deployment.

After downloading my code, I ran `npm install` and then `npm audit fix` because there was a critical security bug. I then spent the next two hours resolving peer dependency conflicts by upgrading all the packages to their latest versions, and then downgrading a couple that were too new for peer dependencies.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/start

### Reproduction Steps**
1. Open the [StackBlitz Angular Example app](https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/getting-started-v0/stackblitz.html) that's referenced [here](https://angular.io/start#create-a-new-project).
1. Click the download button below the Share button.
1. Extract the downloaded zip archive
1. Open the extracted folder in your terminal app
1. Run `npm install`
1. Run `npm audit fix`
1. Run `npm run build`

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
I expect the build to pass, but it fails due to a missing Build class.

## üåç  Your Environment
Windows 10 Home v1903
Windows Susbsystem for Linux running Ubuntu v18.04.3 LTS
Node v10.16.3
npm v6.9.0

### Anything else relevant?
I have my code on github here: https://github.com/carlin-q-scott/angular-kvsbvb

### Features

-   adds asset info for emitted assets
    -   new methods allow easy emitting/updating of assets `compilation.emitAsset/updateAsset` (instead of accessing the Object `compilation.assets`)
    -   new getter methods to get assets `compilation.getAssets()` and `compilation.getAsset(name)`
    -   3 flags in asset info:
        -   `immutable`: when set an asset can be cache infinitely

    -   Stats expose `info` object in assets

Issues.Title: Optimization generates style warnings by @media print queries and removes style definitions.
Issues.Body:
I've implemented a website that has multiple themes. It is possible to switch between the themes without reloading the app. For this each theme has an own style file where the 3rd party dependencies are imported wrapped by a class to use their SCSS variables and to style the elements (e.g. the buttons) without overwriting each statement of the 3rd party style files where a color is already set. In addition, there are specific styles of the website divided in several files (base.scss, print.scss, ...). All of them are imported in a single file named `portal.scss` that is included in the angunar.json. The imports are wrapped by a style statement to create a higher priority of the website styles than the styles of the 3rd party libraries without using `!important`. Everything works fine using `ng serve` (no errors, no warnings). But building or serving the app with `--prod` generates several warnings that a unexpected bracket is at line xyz. I've created a small [example](https://github.com/riede/AngularScssImportFails) to reproduce the behaviour. You can check out the example and run it: When the optimization flag is disabled (`"optimization": false`) in the angular.json the app starts without any warning. I opened the non-optimized style file and jumped to the lines where an unexpected bracket should be. In each case there is a closing bracket of an `@media print` statement. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: build: update sass to version 1.22.12
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [sass](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) | dependencies | patch | [`1.22.10` -> `1.22.12`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass/1.22.10/1.22.12) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.22.12`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​12212)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.22.10...1.22.12)

-   **Potentially breaking bug fix:** character sequences consisting of two or
    more hyphens followed by a number (such as `--123`), or two or more hyphens on
    their own (such as `--`), are now parsed as identifiers [in accordance with
    the CSS spec][ident-token-diagram].

    [ident-token-diagram]: <https://drafts.csswg.org/css-syntax-3/#ident-token-diagram>

    The sequence `--` was previously parsed as multiple applications of the `-`
    operator. Since this is unlikely to be used intentionally in practice, we
    consider this bug fix safe.

##### Command-Line Interface

-   Fix a bug where changes in `.css` files would be ignored in `--watch` mode.

##### JavaScript API

-   Allow underscore-separated custom functions to be defined.

-   Improve the performance of Node.js compilation involving many `@import`s.

</details>

Issues.Title: Declaring a web worker with a comma after the last object breaks the build
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Don't know ### Description I'm using a web-worker like the following: ```ts new Worker('./enigma-bombe.worker', { name: 'enigma-worker', type: 'module' }), ``` If I change it to: ```ts new Worker('./enigma-bombe.worker', { name: 'enigma-worker', type: 'module', }), ``` (notice the last comma) It breaks the app while it's valid code. Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/core): auto discover multiselect schema prompt types
Issues.Body: If a prompt is present on a schema property and the type is an array with a set of enum values, then the prompt type is a list with multiselect capabilites.  This eliminates the need to specify the longhand form for typical multiselect prompts.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/core): auto discover multiselect schema prompt types" (#15569)

Issues.Title: build: update minimum npm/yarn engine versions for built packages
Issues.Body:
The `peerDependenciesMeta` package.json field is becoming increasingly prevalent.  The minimum versions in this change provide support for the field and mitigate incorrect peer dependency warnings for end users.

npm: https://github.com/npm/cli/blob/fc5fc76182c0746433c84a7208877fb70ef62352/CHANGELOG.md#v6110-2019-08-20
yarn: https://github.com/yarnpkg/yarn/blob/53d8004229f543f342833310d5af63a4b6e59c8a/CHANGELOG.md#1130
pnpm:
https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/releases/tag/v3.2.0

``` I think angular is much better project than Vue (I love the module separation, DI and great Typescript support , it provide much better isolation than Vue ) ### Describe the solution you'd like the angular should build a `angular.vendor.min.js` when build with `--vendor` and a set of new way to use the module directly. for example: ```html
```

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully optimize script bundles with bundle downleveling
Issues.Body:
Script bundles were not being subject to the terser mangle optimizations when using bundle down leveling.
This change also allows terser to perform ECMA 6 level compress and output optimizations on the actual application bundles (non-script bundles) which can provide for further size improvements.  Also limits the parsing for optimizations of the script bundles to one step.

Fixes #15489
Supersedes #15507
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully optimize script bundles with bundle downleveling" (#15566)

Issues.Title: support option passthrough (additionalProperties) in schematics and builders
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [x] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
I want to create schematics and builders that support options not explicitly defined in the schema.  

For example, I want to create a builder that spawns a command just passing through the options from the cli. Pretty much like the [example](https://angular.io/guide/cli-builder#schedule-and-run) in angular.io website although instead of defining `command` and `args` options I'd like the user to type (or define in a target) the options as she or he were executing the command directly. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
According to json-schema's draft, [it is possible](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#pattern-properties) to combine `properties`, `propertiesPatterns` and `additionalProperties` to define a schema that allows any property and even control the allowed types.

Currently, the cli only considers `boolean` as the possible type of the property `additionalProperties`. 

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/fe8666073b4f357d4614bf90ac39225980ebe24c/packages/angular/cli/models/architect-command.ts#L244

I'd suggest to make changes in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/fe8666073b4f357d4614bf90ac39225980ebe24c/packages/angular/cli/utilities/json-schema.ts#L136 to consider an object as possible value of the property `additionalProperties` and parse the options not included in the `properties` object using its value as definition. 

So, if I create a builder with a schema as follows:

```
 {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/schema",
  "title": "My builder",
  "description": "Executes a command",
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "properties": {
    "command": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Command to be executed"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "command"
  ],
  "definitions": {
  }
}
```

And I pass the following options to the method `parseJsonSchemaToOptions`:

```
['--command', 'my-script', '--foo', 'bar']
```

The method returns the following array:

```
[
 {
   "name": "command",
   "type": "string",
   "required": true,
   "hidden": false
 }
]
``` 

Ignoring the option `--foo`. 

In my option when additionalProperties is an object it should use its value to define the rest of properties returning the following array:

```
[
 {
   "name": "command",
   "type": "string",
   "required": true,
   "hidden": false
 },
 {
   "name": "foo",
   "type": "string",
   "required": false,
   "hidden": false
]
``` 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
If the property `additionalProperties` is set `true` the options not defined explicitly are "stashed" in a property with the name "--" and therefore builders can access to them. 

However, this is not an intuitive workaround and requires the developers to parse these options (split them when using `=` or pair them when using them separately).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "support option passthrough (additionalProperties) in schematics and builders" (#15565)

Issues.Title: matTooltip on mat-header-cell adds aria-describedby which is not removed when tooltip becomes null
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-7rtgt9

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a matTooltip to a header cell and bind it so that it returns null if no rows are selected, or 'x selected' if there are some rows selected.
2. Note that initially, before any rows are selected, there is no aria-describedby attribute on the header cell.
3. Select all rows so the tooltip is now bound to the 'x selected' message.
4. Note that the tooltip, now in action, also creates an aria-describedby attribute and its value is the name of an element with the tooltip's message.
5. Deselect all rows so the tooltip is bound to null again. 

 
#### Expected Behavior

I would expect to see the aria-describedby attribute removed from the header cell


#### Actual Behavior

The aria-describedby attribute remains, with no value. This can cause issues for accessibility.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.1.4
- CDK/Material: 8.1.4
- Browser(s): Chrome 77.0.3865.75 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matTooltip on mat-header-cell adds aria-describedby which is not removed when tooltip becomes null" (#17070)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/button): ripples were using mat-button styles
Issues.Body:
The button was using the class `mat-button-ripple` for its ripple container, which was actually using the MatButton's style since the button is always loaded on all pages of the dev app. 

This renames the ripple style to make it unique and brings the necessary styles over (fill the ripple container to the button, fix border radius)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material-experimental/button): ripples were using mat-button styles" (#17069)

Issues.Title: [cdk-connected-overlay] add animation support on opening and closing
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Reference to closed issue [cdk-connected-overlay] add animation support on opening and closing #5127

Provide a brief summary of the feature you would like to see.

#### Use Case

Describe the use case(s) that the proposed feature would enable.

Currently it is not possible to animate an open and close transition when using cdk-connected-overlay. While you can animate the content inside the overlay you can't animate the cdk overlay transition itself so it looks pretty wonky and unappealing. The overlay itself is what should be animated not the content. 


Maybe something like this would be great!

   [cdkConnectedOverlayTransitionIn]="180ms ease-in "

   [cdkConnectedOverlayTransitionOut]="200ms ease-out "
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[cdk-connected-overlay] add animation support on opening and closing" (#17068)

Issues.Title: Add buffer mode to MatSlider
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Introduce a buffer mode to MatSlider, similar to the one already available in MatProgressBar

#### Use Case

In most video or audio streaming players it may be required to show the amount of buffer being downloaded during the playback. Adopting a progress bar isn't enough because the user needs to be able to seek back and forth in the media, which requires a slider. I'm suggesting a slider bar with the ability to draw a buffer line, with a customizable color.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add buffer mode to MatSlider" (#17065)

Issues.Title: Reduce duplication of configured entry-points
Issues.Body:
We currently hard-code all entry-points in:

* `//:packages.bzl`
* `//src/dev-app:system-config.js`.

It should be possible to move them to one place (e.g. through a genrule for dev-app). It's not ideal that new entry-points need to be added to multiple files (which are unknown to the implementer)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reduce duplication of configured entry-points" (#17064)

Issues.Body:

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Handle docs generation for tertiary entry-points" (#17063)

Issues.Title: select: fix maximum call stack size error and improve performance in multiple mode
Issues.Body:
These changes fix "Maximum call stack size exceeded" error when selecting lots of options by value (e.g. clicking on a button).
Also improve performance by checking which options have to be selected/deselected when a new value comes in. Currently `SelectionModel` is cleared and options are selected by one every time `select` value changes. This leads to poor performance when there are many options.

Fixes #12504
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "select: fix maximum call stack size error and improve performance in multiple mode" (#17062)

Issues.Title: [Scroll] MatSelect Options scroll over other elements.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction



Steps to reproduce:
1. Visit https://material.angular.io/components/select/examples
2. Click on a select (the options dialog should open)
![step1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29603738/64762476-8eae7f80-d53e-11e9-9010-4ef10e2b0099.PNG)
3. Scroll your screen with the mousewheel outside of the options without clicking
4. Options schould stay visible while screen scrolls
 ![BugReport](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29603738/64762416-6f175700-d53e-11e9-8d05-a63d526f67bd.PNG)


 
#### Expected Behavior

Options close once the Select Element is out of the ViewPort and should most definetly not overlay other components.

I feel like there should be a trigger that checks whether the select field should be visible i.e. is in viewport and not overlayed by another component and close the options in that case.

#### Actual Behavior

Options stay open and even block the header.



#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.
- CDK/Material: MatSelect
- Browser(s): Chrome, Internet Explorer 10, Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10



This behaviour looks quite ugly in my app and I am struggling to come up with a clean and performance friendly solution to my problem, since I don't really want to flood my app with .getBoundingClientRect() calls.

Any advice?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Scroll] MatSelect Options scroll over other elements. " (#17061)

Issues.Title: feat(material/dialog): update dialog subjects to be AsyncSubjects
Issues.Body:
AsyncSubjects have the advantage over other types of Subjects that any subscription made after the subject is marked as complete is still provided with the value.
Specifically for dialogs, this allows the consumer to delay subscribing to the afterClosed observable and still get the result from their dialog.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/dialog): update dialog subjects to be AsyncSubjects" (#17057)

Issues.Title: mat-errors that are tied to a custom ErrorStateMatcher aren't triggered when clicking next on mat-horizontal-stepper component
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Trying to make material stepper perform in linear mode when using controls that have custom validators. In my stackblitz posted below I have 3 controls in a mat step (step 1). I have a custom validation check on 'start date' and 'end date'. The custom validator checks to make sure start date does not exceed 'end date'. There is also a 'required' validator attached to 'end date'. When I click on the header to go to step 2 all the other controls show that they are empty except for 'end date'. I suppose I wanted to start troubleshooting at the most basic level. My initial question is: does 'linear' mode also trigger the display of errors when they are attached to a custom ErrorSateMatcher? In my real world app clicking on the 'next' button behaves the same way. In my stackblitz the 'next' button works for some reason.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

By default when clicking 'next' in the mat step component the controls are checked for validity and errors are displayed. However I have noticed that my custom controls do not display the errors even when the validity is checked. 

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cumv75?file=app/stepper-overview-example.html

#### Environment

- Angular: @angular/core@6.1.10
- CDK/Material: 6.4.7
- Browser(s): Chrome 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-errors that are tied to a custom ErrorStateMatcher aren't triggered when clicking next on mat-horizontal-stepper component" (#17056)

Issues.Title: [Drag&Drop] Use descendants: true when dealing with ContentChildren in most drap&drop directives
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The change to descendants: true for drag handle in Drag directive was welcoming change. Allow for deeper traversal using descendants:true for other content children also, for example cdkDragPreview and cdkDragPlaceholder.

#### Use Case

Advanced component nesting scenarios are currently blocked or require cumbersome workarounds like slot projections as pictured here https://github.com/angular/components/pull/13360#issuecomment-463137794

When most issues would be solved with deep traversal for content children.

Also, the new policy of locking issues which already cover the topic like here https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784 does not help the conversation at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Drag&Drop] Use descendants: true when dealing with ContentChildren in most drap&drop directives" (#17047)

Issues.Title: Datepicker dates and manually entered dates differs
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-du34ef
https://angular-du34ef.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Choose a date with the date picker, for example 10th of September 2019. With my locale ('sv'), the selected date will be '2019-09-09T22:00:00.000Z' as presented in the page after selection.
2. Manually enter a date, for example 9th of September 2019. In my test I typed in 2019-09-09 and the selected date became '2019-09-09T00:00:00.000Z'
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I was expecting that I would get the same selected date no matter selection method. 


#### Actual Behavior

Selecting a date via date picker resulted in a correct UTC-formatted date. But the manually entered date was not correct. It seems like the manually entered is expected to be entered in UTC, not in my current locale.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.5
- CDK/Material: 8.1.4
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Datepicker dates and manually entered dates differs" (#17045)
